position.marginalia_text: Panis quotidianus Eutrapeli, { Facettia[e]. apophthegmata. Epigrammata.

marginalia.translation: Eutrapelus' daily bread: jokes, aphorisms, epigrams.

position.marginalia_text: Mens cuiusq[ue], is est quisq[ue]. Animus est omnia. Epictetus est duo verba,

marginalia.translation: Whose mind is everthing. The intellect is all things. Epictetus is in two words: be patient and desist. Seneca, in two ...

position.marginalia_text: Viri est, quotidiana arte, et exercitatione efficere, vt sua singula membra plus valeant aliorum membris: et sui externi, interniq[ue] sensus alioru[m] sensibus pra[e]polleant. vt
vt validissimarum partium inductione, ipsum Totum fiat

marginalia.translation: Man's task, through daily art and exercise, is to bring to pass that his individual members are worth more than those of others, and that his external and internal senses are much stronger than those of others. In order that, with the production of most powerful parts, his entire person becomes ...
